sentences.sContent: He only pursues writing-only careers like novelist, journalist or copyrighter, when instead, he could have looked into being a minister, public relations assistant, editor or government lobbyist.
sentences.sContent_eng: He only pursues writing-only careers like novelist, journalist or copyrighter, when instead, he could have looked into being a minister, public relations assistant, editor or government lobbyist.
sentences.sCn: 他只追求纯写作的职业，比如小说家、记者或剧作家，而实际上，他也可以找代理人、公共关系助手、编辑或政府说客之类的工作。

words.tran: 大厅；休息室；会客室；游说议员的团体

trans.tranOther: A lobbyist is someone who tries actively to persuade a government or council that a particular law should be changed or that a particular thing should be done
